body:
Does the API docs really claim that it normalizes the parts/URLs?

> Maybe this should have been fixed in the libcurl layer, not the trurl layer?

Maybe.

> It seems it doesn't decode percent-encoding in the schema either

RFC 3986 does not allow percent-encoding there as I recall it.

> Does the API docs really claim that it normalizes the parts/URLs?

[I think so](https://github.com/curl/curl/blob/master/docs/libcurl/curl_url_get.md?plain=1#L147-L150)?

> ## CURLUPART_URL
> 
> When asked to return the full URL, curl_url_get(3) returns a **normalized** and
> possibly cleaned up version using all available URL parts.

I don't know what it means by "possibly" cleaned up, but "normalized" is well-defined.

Also, [people in the wild](https://gist.github.com/lemire/7a64fa2732e5e35f65568a0f98a9db18) does seem to be happily assuming it's normalizing, which (IMO) is a good reason to straighten up the implementation.

I mean... why would it normalize some parts but not others? I'd suggest settling with either nothing or everything, otherwise it's a trap.

> returns a normalized and possibly cleaned up version

Thanks, yeah it clearly does, so definitely a bug.

issue.title: urlapi: normalize retrieved URLs

labels.name: feature-window
labels.description: A merge of this requires an open feature window

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
The API documentation for curl_url_get() mentions normalizing when extracting a URL (only), so this code does not affect retrieving the individual components.

## normalizing

It implies URL decoding + URL encoding every URL part, independently and then put the cleansed versions together into a full URL. This process can however not be an *unconditional*  decode + encode for each part since generally URL encoding would encode characters that users might actually prefer even need to have as-is in the URL. An example being `=` in the query part, that is typically treated differently than `%3D`. This makes *normalizing* opinionated and not strictly a spec thing.

## todo:

- [X] normalize (lowercase) hostnames
- [X] normalize path
- [X] normalize query
- [X] normalize fragment
- [X] normalize user
- [X] normalize password
- [X] normalize option
- [X] add option to select normalizing: `CURLU_NORMALIZE`
- [X] document new option
- [X] document exactly how the normalization is done and works

Extend test 1560 to verify

Fixes #16829
Reported-by: Alberto Leiva Popper

body:
I brought the larger question to the mailing list to see if people have thoughts:

https://curl.se/mail/lib-2025-03/0029.html

> Also, a user might not need/want this normalization to get done. Maybe we need
> a flag to enable/disable? 

I'm okay with this. Something like `CURLU_FULL_NORMALIZATION`.

> Before I complete this work and risk wasting time going down the wrong rabit
> hole

I'm willing to offer man hours, if this helps
@ydahhrk I would appreciate your feedback on #16841
